title: Organizational Diversity Management: Learning Practices and Change Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of organizational culture and basic human resource management concepts
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning environment for managerial learners interested in establishing and implementing diversity policies within organizations.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and explain at least three cases of diversity management and learning practices within organizations

Learners propose three action plans for improving diversity policies in multicultural organizations using collective knowledge-building (Delphi method, workshops) and organizational memory strategies (knowledge management systems, case databases), validating feasibility with quantitative metrics (participation ≥80%, satisfaction ≥4.0/5.0).

Learners apply three CoP (Community of Practice) design principles (shared purpose, participation structure, knowledge-sharing system) to create ≥2 virtual learning scenarios for multicultural participants, achieving ≥4/5 on two of three peer-evaluation rubric items (clarity, feasibility, diversity reflection).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
